snippet: Diamond Resorts’ stock has held up despite a delayed earnings report, because it’s about to be bought. So why did an ex-director cash in so much stock?...
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column examines how accounting error discovered by auditor BDO USA in Diamond Resorts International's books will affect pending $2.2 billion acquisition of Diamond by Apollo Global Management; notes situation has been complicated by fact that longtime Diamond insider Lowell D Kraff is cashing in on his shares before deal goes through.
lead_paragraph: Diamond Resorts’ stock has held up despite a delayed earnings report, because it’s about to be bought. So why did an ex-director cash in so much stock?

headline.print_headline: A Math Hiccup That Could Become a Headache
headline.main: Accounting Error May Not Derail Deal, but Ex-Director Bails Early Anyway
